name: Thorpe Park
description: Thorpe Park is one of Flagstaff's most beloved family parks, featuring a large playground with modern equipment suitable for various age groups. The park includes swings, slides, climbing structures, and a sand play area. With its expansive green spaces, it's perfect for picnics and outdoor games. The park also has sports facilities including basketball and tennis courts.
shortDescription: Large community park with modern playground, sports courts, and picnic areas.
topPickReason: The best all-around playground in Flagstaff with equipment for all ages and plenty of shade.
tips: Bring sunscreen even on cloudy days - the high altitude means stronger UV
The restrooms are near the basketball courts
Great for birthday parties with reservable picnic areas

name: Bushmaster Park
description: Bushmaster Park offers a fantastic playground set among tall ponderosa pines, providing natural shade throughout the day. The playground features climbing equipment, swings, and slides. The park is known for its peaceful atmosphere and beautiful forest setting, making it a great escape for families.
shortDescription: Shaded forest playground with climbing equipment surrounded by ponderosa pines.
address: 3150 N Alta Vista Dr, Flagstaff, AZ 86004
tips: Natural shade from pine trees keeps it cool in summer
Watch for pine cones on the ground

name: Foxglenn Park
description: Foxglenn Park is a popular neighborhood park featuring a well-maintained playground, open fields for running and sports, and scenic walking paths. The playground has equipment suitable for younger children with some climbing structures for older kids as well.
shortDescription: Neighborhood park with playground, open fields, and walking paths.
tips: Great for flying kites on windy days
Connected to urban trail system for biking

name: McPherson Park
description: McPherson Park is a charming downtown park with a playground that's perfect for younger children. Located near Wheeler Park, it offers a quieter alternative with swings, slides, and climbing equipment. The historic downtown location makes it easy to combine with other activities.
shortDescription: Downtown park with toddler-friendly playground near historic center.
tips: Walk to downtown restaurants and shops after playing
Close to the train station - kids love watching trains!

name: Chick-fil-A Indoor Playground
description: The Chick-fil-A in Flagstaff features an enclosed indoor playground, making it perfect for rainy or snowy days. The climate-controlled play area lets kids burn energy while parents enjoy a meal. The playground is cleaned regularly and is great for toddlers and younger children.
shortDescription: Indoor playground perfect for bad weather days with food options.
tips: Go early to avoid lunch rush crowds
Kids' meals come with a toy

name: Arroyo Park
description: Arroyo Park features a unique playground with a nature-inspired design. The park includes climbing boulders, slides, and swings, all set against a backdrop of natural Arizona landscape. It's a great spot for kids who love more adventurous play equipment.
shortDescription: Nature-themed playground with unique climbing features and natural landscaping.
tips: Great for kids who like climbing
